title: Caos-Caos

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of oil on canvas.

credit_line: Gift of The Leonard and Ruth Horwich Family Foundation
publication_history:
Ministerio de Educación, Exposición Lam: obras receintes, exh. brochure (Ministerio de Educación, 1950), n.pag., cat. 13.

Whitechapel Art Gallery, 20th-Century Form: Painting, Sculpture and Architecture, exh. cat. (Whitechapel Art Gallery, 1953) p. 7, cat. 24 (by error as Caos-Caos, 1952).

Max-Pol Fouchet, Wifredo Lam (Éditions Cercle d’Art, 1976), pp. 236, cat. 440 (ill.); 258 (as A point, 1948).

André Pieyre de Mandiargues, “W lam!,” special issue of XXe siècle, 52 (July 1979), p. 65 (color ill.).

Dawn Ades, Mary Mathews Gedo, Mary Jane Jacob, Rosalind E. Krauss, Dennis Alan Nawrocki, Lowery Stokes Sims, In the Mind’s Eye: Dada and Surrealism, ed. Terry Ann R. Neff, exh. cat. (Museum of Contemporary Art, Chicago/Abberville Press, 1984), p. 163 (ill. by error as Untitled, circa 1965).

Max-Pol Fouchet, Wifredo Lam, 2nd ed. (Ediciones Polígrafa, 1989), p. 256, cat 472 (ill.); 278 (as Ready, 1948).

Lou Laurin-Lam, Wifredo Lam: Catalogue Raisonné of the Painted Work, Volume I, 1923–1960 (Acatos, 1996), p. 435, cat. 50.54 (ill.)

Lowery Stokes Sims, Wifredo Lam and the International Avant-Garde, 1923–1982 (University of Texas Press, 2002), p. 102.
exhibition_history:
Havana, Parque Central, Exposicion Lam: obras receintes, 1950, Oct. 2–15, 1950, cat. 13.

London, Whitechapel Art Gallery, 20th-Century Form: Painting, Sculpture and Architecture, Apr. 9–May 31, 1953, cat. 24 (by error as Caos-Caos, 1952).

Chicago, Museum of Contemporary Art, In the Mind’s Eye: Dada and Surrealism in Chicago Collections, Dec. 1, 1984–Jan. 27, 1985, no cat. no. (by error as Untitled, circa 1965).
provenance_text: Private collection, by 1953 [London 1954]. Sold through Frumkin Gallery, Chicago, to Leonard J. and Ruth P. Horwich, Chicago, by 1976 [email from attorneys for Horwich estate, June 23, 2016, copy in curatorial object file; Fouchet 1976, p. 278]; by descent to the Leonard and Ruth Horwich Family Foundation, Chicago, 2014; given in partial interest to the Art Institute of Chicago, April 21, 2015; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, July 6, 2016.
